model_answer: The preceding sub-event most likely causing the shutdown-and-layoff outcome is option B: Event 7: The capitalist appropriates produced value beyond wages, allocating it to maintenance, materials, and especially expanding production and personal luxuries (audio), shown by a large “value” bar versus a small “wage” bar and boxes for Production Costs and Expanding Production (visual). This event shows how capitalists prioritize their own profits over the needs of workers, leading to a situation where there may be more goods produced than needed, profits fall, and capitalists may have to lay off workers to cut costs.

The most directly building event towards the revolutionary conclusion in communist economics is option B: Event 9. In this event, the speaker discusses the exploitation of workers enabled by private property and raises the question of whether private property should be abolished. This aligns with the idea of communal ownership of the means of production, which is a key aspect of Marxist economics and ultimately leads to the revolution depicted in the video.
